definition: to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to get rid of/to remove/to exclude/to eliminate/to wipe out/to divide/except/not including

sentences.english: Some of your people will also need to bedismissed because of excessive absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 你的某些员工，经常旷工，因而也需要被开除。

sentences.english: Her boss threatened to fire her.
University student Kicked Out OfSchoolFor Censuring Foreign LanguageEducation?
sentences.chinese: 炮轰外语教育大学生被开除？

sentences.english: And in that former life you had an affair with a superior officer's wife and they pushed you out.
sentences.chinese: 你以前曾与你的上司的妻子有绯闻，为此你被开除了。

sentences.english: The company dismissed first those who were fast and loose with their work.
sentences.chinese: 公司首先开除了那些三天打鱼，两天晒网的人。

sentences.english: They booted him out of the company for not working.
sentences.chinese: 他们以他不工作为由把他开除出公司。

sentences.english: The first baseman was dumped from the team.
sentences.chinese: 第一守垒员被球队开除了。

sentences.english: Sharpton says he wants Imus to be fired.
sentences.chinese: 沙普顿表示他希望艾默斯被开除。

sentences.english: If you get into trouble again, you'll be expelled .
sentences.chinese: 如果你再闯祸就会被开除的。

sentences.english: In retaliation, the Whigs expelled Tyler from their party.
sentences.chinese: 由于政见的抵触，泰勒被辉格党开除出党。

sentences.english: Mark my words. I'll fire you if you make the same mistake again.
sentences.chinese: 记住我说的，再犯这种错误的话，我要把你开除。

sentences.english: Mr. O'Hara. You must dismiss Jonas Wilkerson.
sentences.chinese: 夏先生，你必须开除伟基信。

sentences.english: Former Chinese supreme court vice president sacked for corruption.
sentences.chinese: 最高法原副院长黄松因腐败问题有被开除公职。

sentences.english: Meeting and in connection with the expulsion of Chang Kuo-tao.
sentences.chinese: 会议上的斗争和开除张国焘出党的斗争。

sentences.english: The boy was pitched out of the school for failing to pass the examination again.
sentences.chinese: 那男孩因考试又不及格被开除了学籍。

definition: to eliminate/to sack/to remove from office
to try to persuade sb to give up (their job, plans etc)
to strike off (the rolls)/to remove from a list/to expunge/to expel
to relieve sb of his post/to sack/to demote/dismissal/sacking
to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
